discussion.content: Agree with AD - E is not part of the main components of the methodology

choices.D: Busy hour call attempts, where the busy hour call attempts system is the user busy hour call attempts multiplied by the number of users.
choices.E: Interaction between individual products may require the addition of Cisco UCM server nodes.
choices.B: Cisco TelePresence conductor capacity and sizing can be considered on a region-by-region basis.
choices.A: Performance testing measures resource usage (CPU, memory) accurately for each function.
choices.C: System Busy Hour Call Attempts is calculated by multiplying the number of users by the maximum number of call attempts during the busiest hour of the year.

questions.question_text: An administrator is configuring LDAP for Cisco UCM with Active Directory integration. A customer has requested to use `ipphone` instead of `telephoneNumber' as the phone number attribute. Where does the administrator specify this attribute mapping in Cisco UCM?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C.

LDAP-synced CUCM users have their fields mapped to LDAP attributes in the 'LDAP Directory' configuration section.

The 'Phone number' CUCM field is what this question is referencing, and the two native selectable LDAP attributes to select from are 'telephoneNumber' and 'ipPhone'. These are native LDAP attributes and not custom LDAP attributes, therefore it is C, not D.

questions.question_text: Which action must an administrator take to provide a method that plays prerecorded messages when setting up a voicemail server in a Cisco collaboration on-premises system?

choices.B: Configure a directory handler to respond to the calls in Cisco UCM.
choices.A: Create a recording that is applied to a service voicemailbox in Cisco UCM.
choices.C: Create a call handler template to apply to a call handler in Cisco Unity Connection.
choices.D: Configure a telephony service in Cisco Unity Connection to play prerecorded messages applying this service to a number.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A. is not correct, since CUCM as such does not have a native voicemail box service.
B. is not appropriate since Directory Handler is a special and specific handler.
D. is ambiguous, certainly you can integrate the CUC with a telephony service application as a CUCM, but it is not enough by itself.
C. could be more specific than the other options. In many cases, a company might have a recording professionally recorded to provide specific information to the caller, about the organization’s products and services. Another business might have someone in the company with a good speaking voice record its announcement from a script. It is possible with a Call Handler as the Opening Greeting System Call Handler. And the template is to apply a desired set of configurations (Transfer Rules, Caller Input, Greetings, Message Settings, and Post Greeting Recordings) to new call handlers.
Reference:
Cisco Unity Connection - David Schulz.
Chapter 8: Understanding Call Handlers and System Features

Selected Answer: C
ChatGPT says C
Here's why the other options are not correct:

A. Create a recording that is applied to a service voicemailbox in Cisco UCM: This option doesn’t apply to voicemail playback or prerecorded message functionality for general calls.
B. Configure a directory handler to respond to the calls in Cisco UCM: A directory handler is used for caller directory lookup but isn’t designed for playing prerecorded messages.
D. Configure a telephony service in Cisco Unity Connection to play prerecorded messages applying this service to a number: Cisco Unity Connection does not use a "telephony service" for playing messages; this is managed through call handlers or user mailboxes.
Incoming call permissions help to manage the user's receiving call types (such as collect calls).

Selected Answer: C
C is the only one with incomming call that makes sence.

Docs : https://help.webex.com/en-us/article/q94e8c/Configure-calling-permissions-in-Control-Hub

questions.question_text: What is a capability of configuring the Incoming call permissions in a Cisco Webex dial plan?

choices.A: to allow chargeable directory assistance calls
choices.D: to stop users from making collect calls
choices.C: to allow users to receive collect calls

discussion.content:
B Traffic 

Traffic Prioritization: DiffServ allows network administrators to classify and prioritize different types of traffic based on their importance, application requirements, or service agreements. This prioritization ensures that critical traffic, such as real-time voice or video applications, receives preferential treatment over less time-sensitive traffic like email or file downloads.

Selected Answer: B
It is B
The Differentiated Service (DiffServ) is a network solution aimed at classifying the IP traffic flow into traffic classe
